column4: does anyone know what ubuntu uses for tab completion in bash? For example, if I write apt-get it knows my options are install, update, ect
What do you mean "what Ubuntu Uses"  tab completion is built into bash
then what does it use for tab completion? It is different from any other distro
I never noticed!  Thanks for teaching me something knew
I miss the ubuntu commandline when I use arch, debian, ect
My debian seems to be the same as ubuntu (at least with apt-get [tab][tab])
I just installed it a yesterday. I already have it working like ubuntu :-)
I guess I have been using older versions of debian
if he is a self proclaimed n00b, why are you encouraging him to use arch?
Why does being a self-proclaimed noob forfeit the right to learn?
because I have a different option of what a n00b is than he does apparently :-)
no, in theory they are slow and stupid
In practice they are 'ERROR: UNDETERMINED TYPE'
LAMP is be definition not windows :)
